website_summaries.verdict: Fashionable and especially useful for keeping close tabs on daily health and sleep habits, Steel is the hybrid smartwatch for those of us looking to surpass their ultimate fitness goals.
pros: Tracks steps, calories burned, distance traveled, etc
Monitors sleep duration, cycles, and interruptions
cons: This hybrid smartwatch is health focused, so if you need to be reminded about emails and Twitter messages, this isn’t the device for you

customer_reviews.title: wow a tracker that looks like a watch
customer_reviews.text: This is freeing. I have worn a fitbit versa most recently and found it very inaccurate-logging 2000 to 4000 steps and 13 floors on my 10 minute drive to work and the reminders to move not working. Love the simplicity of the withings and the looks. It is nowhere near as clunky on my small wrist as the versa and looks way better. I like the healthmate app very much. Best $36 I ever spent. I believe this will motivate me to move more as the count is way more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive watch, horrible tracking
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted to love this watch. I love its appearance, it truly is a great looking watch. The problem is with the tracking. It seems like it wants to limit errant steps to a fault. I have a lower end smart watch that does this very well. It is highly accurate. With the Withings, it might not even recognize you are walking 50 yards sometimes before it kicks in counting steps. I suspect if you used it to track walking activity as an exercise, it does okay. But if you are used to counting all of your steps in a day, you will be very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Damocles

customer_reviews.title: My activity.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Withings Activity watch - the first lasted almost exactly 2 years, but that's probably due to my misuse. Scratched all over, I tripped and fell the other day and that was the first one's end. I use it to tell the time and show my physical activity, without showing that I am really concerned about it - because it looks like a watch. The activity is important to me even though it really just means the activity sensed by my right or left wrist! I am a person who is suffering from SBMA so my muscles are disappearing, but it it still good to see that I can do something.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: It was BROKEN - Arrived with glass on watch shattered
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with glass shattered and hands not working - looks like Focus Camera LLC shipped out a broken product and now I need to go through the hassle of returning this directly to them as opposed to usual return method of dropping off at UPS?? Ridiculous, what a waste of my time
customer_reviews.author: Krísh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do anything well
customer_reviews.text: This is 10 months and one battery change in. It only downloads data when I spend between 5 and 20 minutes telling it to over and over again. The time has to be reset on the app and that needs to be done every few days so more time spent/wasted. It is also not very accurate at counting steps when compared to the 4 other trackers I have worn at the same time to check. If I had it to do again I would have been better off with a super cheap Chinese tracker or a Casio watch because that would have at least told me the time.
customer_reviews.author: M D

customer_reviews.title: The watch would not work!
customer_reviews.text: After trying to have the watch calibrate it would not work or stay at correct time. I contacted customer service for Nokia and they gave me the same intructions the watch came with to try, Their emails just kept asking questions when I specifically explained what I had done and maybe it should've come with a battery if they didn't know how old it was. They just said to turn clockwise and counter clockwise twice. It did not work after few attempts and they said they would recommend I return item to my "current country of residence". So I am
customer_reviews.author: 2Amiga

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most accurate tracker. I’m a mom of 3 and thus, I’m usually carrying something. This tracker only counts steps if you’re swinging your arm by your side. I’ve carried it in my pocket a few days and that does increase accuracy but also kind of defeats the purpose of a wrist watch. It does looks great tho. And the sleep tracking is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Impressive activity tracker.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this watch. I really like the iphone app and it has the features that I like. I just had to change the band since it was rubber/plastic and it seems to cause a rash. I hope the battery lasts 6-8 months as mentioned. The face of the watch is more impressive then those other activity trackers that just have a bunch of numbers. I also did not having to slide the face until the watch worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Arkell

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep time or mileage accurately
customer_reviews.text: It's a good looking watch, but the band broke about 3 months out. Plus, it doesn't keep time well. You have to reset it with your phone daily and - after 1.5 years - it doesn't even keep accurate time through the day. Add to that - I went on hiking trip in a national park and realized that my Withings always showed few steps than the posted mileage. A seven mile trail and Withings showed lowed 1200's; a 10 mile trail and Withing showed 17,052 - no wonder I struggle to get to 10K! No point in wearing it and not heavy enough for an anchor. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: nannette

customer_reviews.title: It looks good and is light weight and seems to track your ...
customer_reviews.text: I really this watch. It looks good and is light weight and seems to track your steps relatively accurately. I checked the count vs. my Pebble watch and the counts were with in 15 percent of each other. Which watch is correct, who knows? The watch also tracks sleep, but I haven't really paid any attention to that function. I didn't give the watch five stars because the app is lackluster and the alarm vibration is weak. If you are looking for a hardcore fitness tracker this isn't for you. If you are looking for a something that looks like a regular watch and tracks steps this is the device for you.
customer_reviews.author: TRB

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker
customer_reviews.text: My first Withings watch shattered. Ordered an Activite Steel and RhinoGear screen protector and we're back in business. Friends look at it and say, "That's a good looking watch." Calibration is not the best. The little dial that measures the steps does not shoot back to zero, but rather about 1000 steps back of that that. The end result is accurate, but is disturbing that is does not recalibrate to zero. Tried two reset it, but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: SiestaSam

customer_reviews.title: Prefer This to The Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: Somehwat small on my large wrist. Better suited for a small man or average size woman. But since I wear long sleeve shirts, I am not complaining because sleeve doesn't bind anymore like with my previous analog watch. My other issue is the ghosts steps. Definetly not for the super jocks, but perfect for the person looking to be reminded you how USELESS you have been all day. Between the Apple Watch and the Withings Steel, I prefer the Withings better. I don't need all those bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Noe Longoria

customer_reviews.title: Good looking smart watch, limited functions tho
customer_reviews.text: Good looking smart watch, limited functions tho! My husband received quite a few compliment regarding the look but I wish there are more functions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for traditional watches
customer_reviews.text: I have used this watch for over a year. The brand changed from Within to Nokia and then Withings again. In a form resemble to traditional watch, it carries tracking for daily life. The mobile app always works seamlessly but occasionally it could not connect to the watch and sync data. The battery is also enduring as promised (more than 6 months), while the battery level indicator is not accurately shown in app.
customer_reviews.author: Zhen

customer_reviews.title: Out $100 but at least I don't have to deal with a "Your Device doesn't respond" message when everything else bluetooth driven works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Despite ALL efforts, following reset instructions, bluetooth instructions, etc using a Pixel 2, I COULD NOT get this watch to ever maintain a connection with my phone to even attempt to use. Since the packaging was already disposed of, I can't even return it. The amount of effort and aggrivation TRYING to get it functioning was not worth the trouble and it was disposed of. I expected more out of a Nokia / Withings product. Going back to FitBit which was seemless. Out $100 but at least I don't have to deal with a "Your Device doesn't respond" message when everything else bluetooth driven works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Service

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: This fitness tracker is great, but it does not always get my activity right. If I am going boxing it list it as swimming. It allows you to change the activity, for step counting though its very accurate. . Overall no big issues i have had this brand of watch for years. They typically last 1-2 years. I can wear this watch at work since its not a smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: The Withings software is fine. I purchased this and then also bought a ...
customer_reviews.text: The Activite Steel is a stylish activity tracker with just enough functionality. The battery tends to last a little less time than they advertise however. I always get compliments on the watch and people are shocked when I tell them its a bluetooth activity tracker. The Withings software is fine. I purchased this and then also bought a black leather band since I didn't like the plastic one it came with. Replacing the bands is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to track steps (mostly) and sleep to pass info to the Weight Watchers app. it works fine. The sleep tracking is fine but If I'm lying on the couch reading or watching TV the watch counts that as sleeping.... :)
customer_reviews.author: B. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: The watch is real good but the app is less than perfect
customer_reviews.text: The watch is real good but the app is less than perfect. It recognizes other sports after a while but it does not add the calories burned towards the daily goal that is indicated with the extra hand on the watch. The extra hand is strictly for counting steps. At least some kind of equivalent calories burned showing in the app would be nice. I like the longevity of the battery. The app is also not very developed in determining how many calories are burned with different sports.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this normal looking steps tracking watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Withings watch I got. I bought this for my 13 yr old son. I like the simple design and a normal looking watch with steps and sleep tracking. It is with standing my sons daily use and also is water proof which he can use wile swimming. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice watch that is accurate almost all the time
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice watch. it is also doing almost all the time a great job in being accurate. when I compere it to other trackers that I have, I see sometimes some little differences between this watch and other trackers. but it is 98% accurate (as I said, very small differences). It also one of the most beautiful sport trackers that you can buy
customer_reviews.author: LH123

customer_reviews.title: was great. This is a great product
customer_reviews.text: The entire experience, from opening the box to the setup, was great. This is a great product. However, Nokia just bought Withings, and my only hope now is that they don't ruin the product. They've already released a new version of the app, and a lot of people hate it. Nokia, stop ruining things. There was nothing wrong with the original app. I wish the battery were rechargeable, but 8 months does seem pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch but sleep tracking is not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best looking and long lasting "smart" watch in the market. It's not really smart because you only get simple functions like sleep/step tracking and silent alarm. The App is nice and easy to use and it keeps all your records in one place. The only thing that needs improvement is the sleep tracking accuracy. I found two times when the tracked sleep time is significantly less than the actual time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and Useful
customer_reviews.text: This watch is an elegant and useful for tracking steps throughout the day. It works well with the Withings app and that is the main reason for my purchase since I have other products by that company and been very pleased by them. The watch though does not start tracking as soon as it is placed on the wrist. It takes a moment to kick in. Otherwise another great Withings product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: EXERCISE NUT

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: My phone logs 25 to 35 percent more steps. Connecting and syncing are very slow. Appearance is bigger and thicker than I expected, but it still looks more like a watch than a fitness tracker. I bought black and the hands are difficult to read, especially in certain lighting. There is not as much contrast as the picture shows. I'm a little disappointed in the product, but the shipping was very quick...prime...
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: 7 months in and watch time is off every day. Battery was replaced per Withings support and time is still off 24 hrs later. Anyone else have this problem? Tracking seems off also compared to similar activity on this watch and previous devices. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Low end fitness watch, spend your money elswhere
customer_reviews.text: Watch isn't very durable. Contrary to the other views the glass and metal on my watch show a lot of wear after only a few months. I don't expect it to last six months. The watch band broke already and the product appears to be discontinued now that nokia has re-branded everything. When I contacted support to get a new band it was like pulling teeth, they don't stand behind their product. To top it all off this watch tracks my days as having less steps than my iphone or fitbit does, I really doubt the accuracy of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Benner

customer_reviews.title: Minimalistic and easy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. I am rough on watches but I wanted something inexpensive in case it broke. It connects easily and quickly to the app and I also have a 3rd party app that I used to compare it's data. It is spot on! Love how minimalistic it is.
customer_reviews.author: KayBrumm

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Pretty nice looking, gets compliments, which isn't something I've seen w/ any other activity tracker. It works well, I love the lack of charging required. (I'd inevitably take one off to charge it and leave it forever) Cons: Band could be more comfortable, app could be a bit better. Sleep tracking is flaky. Said I slept 23:50 one day (I had also walked 2 hours?)
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: I really like the look and functionality of this watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look and functionality of this watch. Only complaint is that there is no way to turn off the silent alarm and must wait for the 30 seconds of vibration to finish. Would purchase again Update: The silent alarm function on my watch stopped working 4 months into owning this product. I've replaced the battery as this was indicated as a first sign the battery was low, but that did not fix it. I've become used to waking up with this and it is a big disappointment to have it break. I plan to look into a fitbit replacement as am concerned with quality of Withings now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Strong Activity Tracking with Timeless Style
customer_reviews.text: The Steel follows the Activité and the Activité Pop in its timeless Bauhaus-influenced design, and it looks more upscale than the latter. What's more, the Steel ties you in to the Withings universe of health-related products (scales, blood pressure monitors and more), which I believe is unmatched. It's more than a watch, yet it's also a great-looking watch you can wear anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Elegant tracker.
customer_reviews.text: Elegant tracker. Perfect for the person who doesn’t want a complicated or cluttered digital tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Rupert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tracker with outstanding battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best tracker for my needs. I've had the Samsung Gear and multiple different FitBit products. This one beats them all hands down. I got tired of having to charge my tracker all the time. Battery life is phenomenal on this. I don't need a HR monitor and all that extra nonsense....I just want to count my steps, and this does it well. Classy look. I also have the Withings Scale and everything works flawlessly together with MyFitnessPal.
customer_reviews.author: Just your average Joe...

customer_reviews.title: A conventional looking watch with hidden smart features
customer_reviews.text: i never really liked all these usb charged smart watches that act as an extension to your smart device, but this Withings Activite appears and really acts like a normal analog watch with hidden smart features that could only be revealed when you have the time to pair & explore to your smart device. A winner of both worlds in my opinion. It could be upgraded with added features of date.
customer_reviews.author: Hamad

customer_reviews.title: Super attractive fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Great simple device! Has all the features I wanted out of a basic fitness tracker to help me get moving! Pros: Beautiful Design (have had many compliments!) Easy setup Features (sleep/steps/time/swim) The app is easy to use once you get used to the navigation Cons: The silicon strap (broke already and I've only owned it for 2 weeks) Def would be 5 stars if the strap was little sturdier or if the watch came with an additional strap.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but does not sync well with my blue tooth
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's not meant for Samsung Galaxy 7. Looks nice but does not sync well with my blue tooth. So defeats the purpose for tracking my footsteps. The hour hand is also not ergonomic to adjust. Update: It does sync, however takes a really long time and sometimes disconnects before sync completion.
customer_reviews.author: James Gottschall

customer_reviews.title: OK, It doesn't count all your steps around the ...
customer_reviews.text: OK, It doesn't count all your steps around the house. Focuses more on a stride, when you're walking distances, or in an exercise class. It does record heart rate without any accessories if you have the right phone by shining a light on your finger to record the pulse.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Must buy fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase I've made in 2018! The health mate app is great, and it's even better that's its integrated with a number of other fitness apps like ny fitness pal. I also bought the wifi scale after falling in love wort this watch. There are some minor syncing issues, but nothing that would cause me to be even a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PROF JONES

customer_reviews.title: Hands showing time are often difficult to see with good light (their reflective surface doesn't provide enough contrast to ...
customer_reviews.text: Nokia's support, following its acquisition of Withings, is superb. They immediately replaced the watch for me when the crystal cracked due to the failure of the wrist band. They've now got a customer for life (also bought the scale). Great design both physical and software.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Blair

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this watch!
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a Withings and loved it so much that I bought another. They are amazing watches and very sturdy. They are waterproof and track very well. Would always always recommend this watch to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have all the flashy features of the new Withings watches like ECG etc. However, it does sleep tracking and activity tracking really well and for this price you simply can't go wrong. In terms of looks, it's elegant and sleek; looks like a regular watch plus with the swap-able bands you can spend a little extra and be able to dress it up or down. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Michalis

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful stylish watch
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice, stylish watch. Pros: Stylish Long battery Life Water proof Accurate sleep tracking Cons: Step counting is under estimated. Compared to iPhone builtin 7800 streps(iphone) 5850 (Withings) Companion app still inferior to rivals(Fitbit, Jawbone)
customer_reviews.author: Lian Tuang

customer_reviews.title: I like the look of the watch
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of the watch. I was hesitant because the models were male (I'm female), but it doesn't seem too big at all. I got the black face, and am very happy. It is slower to connect to the app on my iphone than my previous tracker, but I like that I can glance at the watch and know my progress toward my goal without pushing anything.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch. I like that it doesn't look like other fitness trackers but classy. It's taken me some time to get use to the analog. I have noticed if you go over your goal it starts back at 0. When you reach your goal it doesn't let you know. Other frackers vibrate when you do.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A.McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Only looks
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. The silicone band is very comfortable. The bad part is in the tracking abilities. Steps counted were wrong enough to not use as a tracker. Sleep time was off by 4 hours. Doesnt automatically calculate calorie count . Connection to phone was very problematic.
customer_reviews.author: Sarath Joseph

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch and wear it everyday
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch and wear it everyday. If you but one just know that the band is quite terrible and you may want to look for a better one. For the cost it should have came with a better watch band. I replace the original band with a band made for Huawei smartwatch, much better than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Stylish way to track fitness
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and I like how similar it is to a wat h.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree, Bethesda, MD

customer_reviews.title: Simple, and it works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife after I bought her a Fitbit that broke twice. Dead simple, it completely fulfills her needs, while actually looking quite nice. I was actually tempted to buy it for myself simply as a watch, but the price is out of my watch range.
customer_reviews.author: CXC

customer_reviews.title: Great sleep monitor
customer_reviews.text: I found this watch to be perfect in all its applications , I would prefer sapphire glass and the time is difficult to read at night as the dial is a poor color on the 5 min increments, the alarm double tap usually works well on three taps go figure, But 8 moth battery and you dont look like a geek wearing it , this is a winner for me . I am considering upgrading to the HR modle but the charging has issues .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional.
customer_reviews.text: A classic looking watch that's also an efficient fitness tracker. Far better than my old vivo fit. Doesn't look like anything more than handsome watch. The app it connects to is awesome and keeps getting better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: eric Thrapp

customer_reviews.title: What a cool device! I love the simple design
customer_reviews.text: What a cool device! I love the simple design, analog activity dial, and it's a real trip adjusting the time by using your phone – watching the dials turn remotely is cool! I am not a big fan of the silicon band it comes with, so I got a black Milanese loop band (I recommend the one by No1Seller as it has 18mm bar, but the band itself is actually wider which looks really nice).
customer_reviews.author: TheAdamKramer

customer_reviews.title: Was not a new watch
customer_reviews.text: It came in opened and used. I returned it. It did state if they are not new and unopened. That's ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Delayedscholar

customer_reviews.title: ... this because it is a fitness tracker but looks like a watch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it is a fitness tracker but looks like a watch. No longer did I need to wear a watch on one arm and a fitness tracker on the other. Enjoyed this product until less than two months after purchasing the watch crystal shattered. Not sure if anyone else is having this problem but this was a major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Good watch/health tracker
customer_reviews.text: It does not have all the bell's and whistles as the smart watches but it tracks my steps, activity, calories burned and sleep patterns and thats all I need. It looks nice and fits nice. It links up to your bluetooth on your phone and you can access all information from the free downloaded whithings app.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Booher

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a smartwatch to track activity & sleep. This works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, good tracker, still need improvement in apps
customer_reviews.text: Nice design. Steps count even during driving and cannot set more than one vibrating alarm. Vibration level's quite light compared with fitbit alta and other trackers Good tracker anyway
customer_reviews.author: Nam Hong

customer_reviews.title: The Best-looking (and only good-looking) fitness tracker for people who don't want to look like dorks
customer_reviews.text: I get a ton of compliments on this watch. Most people don't realize it's a fitness tracker until I tell them. Sometimes I just don't tell them because no one seems to care about anything but how it looks which is fine by me.
customer_reviews.author: PDV

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The watch band broke within 2 months of buying this. Cheap quality, but I couldn’t return since it was after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Classy and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Classy and convenient! I don't need to charge it which is a big plus. Very comfortable to wear too. I did not wear a watch before and got used to this one in about a week. The only downside is that I wear it when I go rowing and it doesn't do a great job at tracking that.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, and the battery is not just a little ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, and the battery is not just a little better, but A LOT better than a fit bit. Price is cheaper than a fitbit. The silent alarm is awesome, not too jarring. I also use the feature where it tries to wake you up according to how deep your sleep is, which I think helps, but to first order the vibrate is key..
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS!! A friend had one and I really liked that it didn't look like a fitbit. I find them unattractive and I hated always having to charge it. The Apple watch is so obvious - I like this because it's super comfortable and does the job - and no one has to know! I bought an extra band to dress it up.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Fitness tracker disguised as a beautiful watch!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this tracker looks like a watch!! At a glance it tells me what I'd need know, no pressing buttons, switching to different screens. It runs on batteries, no wasting time charging. It's water resistant, so I wear it 24/7, washing dishes, shower, swimming. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: It looks good. I miss the caller id from the Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Do its job. Refreshing to have a device that does not need to be charged constantly . It looks good. I miss the caller id from the Fitbit. App has Touch ID authentication. App Interface looks better than the Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro V. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Classic and simple sportswatch
customer_reviews.text: Fine classic looking watch with extra gadgets! Works quite well with GPS and Bluetooth to connect with your phone and sync your activity data. It easily recognizes running from walking so far and is comfortable to wear. There is no heart rate meter, no touch screen and it is not a smartwatch. Perfect for just activity tracking while staying classy;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing watch, looks amazing and it works well
customer_reviews.text: amazing watch , looks amazing and it works well , the only let down is the strap but it can be easily replaced !!. planning on buying the white one aswell
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good looking so refined
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of the Activité Steel it is a fine piece of jewelry. So many people comment how stunning it looks, when I let them know it's my activity tracker, they want to get one!
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Buchinger

customer_reviews.title: Was Great Until It Broke
customer_reviews.text: Great watch with limited functionality until the band completely broke within 2 months' time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking watch and does the job of an activity ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking watch and does the job of an activity tracker well. It counts steps and it is a decent sleep tracker (I like the app that comes with it a lot). If this is what you are looking for then it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike_brazil

customer_reviews.title: Like it as an everyday watch to wear
customer_reviews.text: Like it as an everyday watch to wear, however, I do not think the watch is very accurate when calculating steps.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Love my HR Steel!
customer_reviews.text: I love that my HR Steel not only tracks my sleep and activities, but it doesn't look like the alien sport-trackers. I love the analog watch look of what is actually a very sophisticated device! Can't wait for the new AFib-tracking watch comes up, for my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift. Recipient said the data is ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. Recipient said the data is not always accurate. Tells him he needs to move more when he has walked 4 miles.
customer_reviews.author: N. Elder

customer_reviews.title: This watch has been great for me
customer_reviews.text: This watch has been great for me. Also, I have had just a couple of minor issues that have been resolved very quickly with the help of their customer service. Great buy. Step tracking is very accurate and also works well for running. I compared it to a stopwatch and a known distance and it was pretty accurate for running time and distance. My only complaint is the lack of a second hand.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Speranza

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and simple
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for about a month and I love it. I know that the Fitbit tends to overcount steps, so I wanted to avoid that. Its tracking is comparable to my old Upmove, which was also an accurate tracker. I got this for the silent alarm and the aesthetics and am satisfied with it. It has the only features I wanted, and it's not ugly. For $100, it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch - I like how it counts only activity ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful watch - I like how it counts only activity - not every step.... I would give it five stars if there were a better community element to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jameslouis

customer_reviews.title: Withings Fitness Watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the watch for three weeks now. Watch is very light on your arm. Only thing that I wish they consider to make the hour and minute hand luminous. Would be helpful when at a movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product-- looks fancy and does a nice job of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product-- looks fancy and does a nice job of keeping time. The activity sensor is not as sensitive as I would like to be, though, particularly when walking on a treadmill, or when using a stationary or a street bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: harvard thompson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sleep tracking seems off, no heart rate. Certain excersizes seem inaccurate for calorie tracking. Links with my fitness pal.
customer_reviews.author: Robageddon

customer_reviews.title: When I got it I think it pretty good, but later the watch usually can't work ...
customer_reviews.text: When I got it I think it pretty good ,but later the watch usually can't work well , The time usually wrong , We must to adjust the time by phone often, But the next time it going to be wrong again ,so plese help me to solve the problem, now the watch is stoping it work,
customer_reviews.author: ZF

customer_reviews.title: I actually like that this looks more like a regular watch
customer_reviews.text: I actually like that this looks more like a regular watch. the metal band is nicer than the one that come with the watch
customer_reviews.author: M3

customer_reviews.title: Stylish watch
customer_reviews.text: It's a really stylish watch, plastic straps doesn't bother me since I don't like wearing leather. I have heard only compliments about it, but technical features are supposed to work better in my opinion. You don't get the quality feeling if you focus on only the technical aspects of the device. The three tap feature has embarrassed me more than it should.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still the best activity tracker/ watch.
customer_reviews.text: The battery doesn't need charging and it automatically and accurately tracks running, walking, sleep and swimming without having to tell it anything. The app is great too. I use their scale too which gives lots of info. I upgraded to the steel from the pop and like the new band much better.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Fancher

customer_reviews.title: stylish, functionable, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: stylish. the size is general, so can fit most of person to wear in daily life. It doesn't need to charge for a long time, very convinience design, don't worry about to carry a charge when go outside for few days trip. And the motion data it got can use Withings's App call Health Mate to integrate with my iPhone, like running, walking, swimming also can showed in the Health kit in iOS. Finally, it has a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best activity monitor
customer_reviews.text: love love love it. the best activity monitor/watch i have had so far (has two fitbits and one garmin). it looks great, works great, and offers superb support.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch. Overall it's really accurate. Love that it automatically detects when you are swimming. Most of the fitness watches are not waterproof - but this one is. It also looks great and most people don't know that you are wearing a fitness tracker because it looks like a watch.
customer_reviews.author: Swim_taxi

customer_reviews.title: I really like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I really like it a lot! It looks stylish and does the job. It's comfortable - and fun to track your steps.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Byron

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Withings. This is just a upgradtion. Baring some disadvantages of not having heart beat reading - rest are wonderful for tracking activities. Interfaces well with my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Narayana Ganesh Holla

customer_reviews.title: Pretty watch, but not precise in time
customer_reviews.text: All my friends think it's a pretty watch, unlike most of the smart watch (fitbit, jawbone, or even apple watch, no offense, but they are ugly). It is waterproof with the origin watch band, but I change it with a leather one because it looks cool. It doesn't have a screw on it, the time is set and calibrate on your phone. One problem, a serious one if a precise time is important for you, the time is not precise. For two weeks the watch can be fast or slow five minutes, it happens, so just don't forget to calibrate it.
customer_reviews.author: Janish

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sync.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t sync! Defective. Not reliable! Please don’t waste your money. Neither Amazon nor Nokia are helping for the replacement. PLEASE DONT BUY THIS WATCH AS IT DOESNT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: Maqbool Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: horrible customer service since being taken over by Nokia
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money now that Nokia took over this brand and doesn't support this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some good - Some not so good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Attractive - looks like a nice watch. Do not have to recharge battery. Water resistant. Easy to use with Withings ap. Cons: Cannot see hour and second hands in some lighting situations. Only one alarm can be set. Sleep tracker thinks I am sleeping sometimes when I am awake and reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband love it, although he said that the sleep time is not to accurate .
customer_reviews.author: J. Urrego

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, great working
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, great working. Replaced my FitBit Charge HR with this. This doesn't have heart rate function but I never found the HR particularly functional either. The App for this - Health Mate - does have function for heart rate. Of course, long battery life is also a big advantage over other trackers. I would certainly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: wlcnyc

customer_reviews.title: Good, minimalistic and classic hybrid watch
customer_reviews.text: The watch is as described the only thing is that the glass is not resistant at all you must take care or install a screen protector. The tracking is accurate sync is easy but in the dark it's useless for the time because the watch hand are in chrome and there is no glowing to see the time in the dark
customer_reviews.author: Frisaq

customer_reviews.title: Best simple fit tracker around.
customer_reviews.text: Best simple budget fit tracker around. Not over complicated. And very classic look
customer_reviews.author: John S Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for calculating swimming mileage
customer_reviews.text: It can track running & walking, but it doesn't ever realize I am swimming when I'm swimming. Not the best for calculating swimming mileage. The vibrating alarm clock is great though.
customer_reviews.author: L. Meyerowitz

customer_reviews.title: loved this watch but had to stop using it because ...
customer_reviews.text: loved this watch but had to stop using it because of the app update. horrible update made it completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Mariano

customer_reviews.title: Like this watch/activity tracker very much
customer_reviews.text: Like this watch/activity tracker very much. Good looks and tech combined. Only problem I had was the size of the band. I have large wrists and the band that came with the watch almost did not fit. I order a different band.
customer_reviews.author: jim marshall

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent fitness tracker for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent fitness tracker for beginners. Very stylish (lots of compliments). The wristband is a very soft silicone, it's comfortable and fit pretty well. I had a lot of concerns that the wristband wouldn't hold up as it's a bit flimsy. I am a very active person (runner, cycler, swimmer) who can put a fitness tracker through the ringer and i found myself taking this off more often than not for fear of breaking it. I actually returned this product as it just simply wasn't for me but I think this would be perfect for someone who is not as active or just wants a beautiful watch that can track their daily steps/sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: light smooth and letting me knowing of my life better. love
customer_reviews.text: My life changed, light smooth and letting me knowing of my life better. love it
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this watch!
customer_reviews.text: Watch only worked about 4 months and died. Nokia does not stand behind their product. Wish I would have looked at all the bad reviews about their customer service before buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Morden

product_meta.title: Withings Activité Steel - Activity and Sleep Tracking Watch
product_meta.description:
Withings Activité Steel - Activity and Sleep Tracking Watch
ASIN: B018SL790Q UPC: 781678073823

MANUFACTURER'S DESCRIPTION
 


In The Know and On The Move Track your activity at a glance. Fully automatic tracking means no buttons to press. The tachometer-inspired sub-dial tracks progress towards your daily goal. Activité Steel automatically detects and tracks all activity, including walks, runs, swims, and sleep. Set your personal goal in the Health Mate app. Activity automatically syncs to the app via BTLE (Bluetooth Low Energy).

Water Activity Encouraged Activité Steel is water-resistant up to 5 ATM (50 meters - 150 feet). Steel automatically detects swimming, so you can track and analyze your water workouts in the Health Mate app. 


Sleep Tracking with Silent Alarm Activité Steel automatically detects sleep patterns including light and deep sleep cycles, sleep interruptions, and the total duration of sleep. Set a silent alarm in the Health Mate app to start your day with a gentle wake-up vibration.


Visualize Trends and Data Steel syncs automatically with your phone so that you can track all progress and view graphs in the free Health Mate app. The app offers expert coaching every step of the way with Activity Insights, a Leaderboard, and Reminders to help you reach your goals.


No More Charging No need for any cables or dock - Activité Steel operates on a standard button cell watch battery to provide up to 8 months of battery life. No charging means you never miss a step.



High-end Finish Beyond technology, Steel's state-of-the-art finish boasts a 316L stainless steel case, chrome hands and a soft silicone sport strap. Its sleek design make it the perfect accessory to help unlock your potential, without compromising on style. 

About the Startup 
Describe your product in 3 words.

Beautiful, smart, motivating 

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

We wanted to design an activity tracker that easily collects meaningful information without the limitations.

What makes your product special?

It's a unique combination of an elegant watch and cutting-edge technology that delivers a complete solution: automatic tracking and a great experience so you can focus on health. 

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

Participating in the Connected Health revolution and empowering customers to take control over their own health and wellness with our beautiful devices and apps. 



BOX CONTAINS
1 x Activity Tracking Watch

See more
feature_bullets: Automatic activity tracking - Steps, runs, swims (water resistant - 50m) and calories burned
Sleep monitoring - Sleep cycle analysis (light and deep sleep) plus silent vibrating alarm
Automatic synchronisation - Visualize trends and data on your smartphone with the free Health Mate app

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK
